nl.sense_os.service

Class DataTransmitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.sense_os.service.DataTransmitter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class DataTransmitter
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class is responsible for initiating the transmission of buffered data. It works by registering the transmission task to the scheduler. The Sense service calls #scheduleTransmissions(Context) when it starts sensing.

    When the transmission task is executed, an Intent is sent to the MsgHandler to empty its buffer.

    The transmission frequency is based on the SensePrefs.Main.SYNC_RATE preference. When the sync rate is set to the real-time setting, we look at the and SensePrefs.Main.SAMPLE_RATE to determine periodic "just in case" transmissions. In case of transmission over 3G we transmit every one hour for energy conservation.
    Author:
    Steven Mulder
